clauses.title: Limitation on Indebtedness
clauses.description: Restricts the borrower from incurring additional debt unless specific conditions (e.g., leverage ratios) are met.
clauses.standard_text: The Borrower shall not, and shall not permit any Restricted Subsidiary to, directly or indirectly, Create, incur, assume or suffer to exist any Indebtedness, except: (a) Indebtedness created hereunder; (b) Indebtedness existing on the Closing Date...
negotiation_points: Basket for general corporate purposes
Carve-out for purchase money debt and capital leases
Acquired debt from permitted acquisitions

clauses.title: Limitation on Liens
clauses.description: Prevents the borrower from pledging assets as collateral to other creditors, protecting the lender's priority.
clauses.standard_text: The Borrower will not, and will not permit any of its Subsidiaries to, create, incur, assume or suffer to exist any Lien upon any of its property, asset or revenues, whether now owned or hereafter acquired, other than Permitted Liens.
negotiation_points: Liens incurred in the ordinary course of business
Liens securing Permitted Indebtedness
Judgment liens within a specific threshold

clauses.title: Restricted Payments
clauses.description: Limits dividends, share buybacks, and other distributions to equity holders to preserve cash for debt service.
clauses.standard_text: The Borrower will not, and will not permit any of its Subsidiaries to, declare or make, or agree to pay or make, directly or indirectly, any Restricted Payment, except...
negotiation_points: Builder basket based on Retained Excess Cash Flow
Unlimited payments if pro forma leverage is below x.x level
Carve-out for tax distributions for pass-through entities

clauses.title: Payment Default
clauses.description: Triggered when the borrower fails to make principal or interest payments on time.
clauses.standard_text: The Borrower shall fail to pay any principal of any Loan or any Reimbursement Obligation when and as the same shall become due and payable, whether at the due date thereof or at a date fixed for prepayment thereof or otherwise.
negotiation_points: Grace period for administrative errors (usually 3-5 days)
Distinction between principal (no grace) and interest (grace period)

clauses.title: Cross-Default
clauses.description: A default under another agreement triggers a default under this agreement.
clauses.standard_text: The Borrower or any Subsidiary (i) fails to make any payment when due (whether by scheduled maturity, required prepayment, acceleration, demand, or otherwise) in respect of any Material Indebtedness...
negotiation_points: Threshold amount for Material Indebtedness
Cross-Acceleration vs. Cross-Default (acceleration is more borrower-friendly)

clauses.title: Change of Control
clauses.description: Allows the lender to exit if the ownership of the borrower changes significantly.
clauses.standard_text: A Change of Control shall occur.
negotiation_points: Definition of beneficial ownership percentage
Permitted holders (e.g., original sponsors/founders)
IPO exceptions

clauses.title: Total Net Leverage Ratio
clauses.description: The ratio of Consolidated Total Net Debt to Consolidated EBITDA.
clauses.standard_text: The Borrower will not permit the Total Net Leverage Ratio as of the last day of any Fiscal Quarter to exceed [MAX_RATIO].
negotiation_points: Step-downs over time
EBITDA add-backs (synergies, one-time costs)
Netting of unrestricted cash

clauses.title: Interest Coverage Ratio
clauses.description: The ratio of Consolidated EBITDA to Consolidated Interest Expense.
clauses.standard_text: The Borrower will not permit the Interest Coverage Ratio as of the last day of any Fiscal Quarter to be less than [MIN_RATIO].
negotiation_points: Definition of Interest Expense (cash vs. PIK)
Minimum level logic based on cushion to projections
